remarks: The set of ring homomorphisms.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)
statement:
rnghomval.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rnghomval.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
rnghomval.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
rnghomval.4 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
rnghomval.5 $e |- J = ( 1st ` S ) $.
rnghomval.6 $e |- K = ( 2nd ` S ) $.
rnghomval.7 $e |- Y = ran J $.
rnghomval.8 $e |- V = ( GId ` K ) $.
rngohomval $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps ) -> ( R RngHom S ) = { f e. ( Y ^m X ) | ( ( f ` U ) = V /\ A. x e. X A. y e. X ( ( f ` ( x G y ) ) = ( ( f ` x ) J ( f ` y ) ) /\ ( f ` ( x H y ) ) = ( ( f ` x ) K ( f ` y ) ) ) ) } ) $.
$d G f $.
$d H f $.
$d J f $.
$d K f $.
$d R f x y $.
$d S f x y $.
$d U f $.
$d V f $.
$d X f x y $.
$d Y f y $.
$d f x y $.
